intro: Agrostis flaccida var. festucoides, commonly known as slender meadow grass, is a cool-season grass species native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It features tufted,丛生 growth habit with narrow, grass-like leaves that are typically bluish-green in color. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences containing numerous tiny, wind-pollinated flowers. It thrives in moist to wet soils and is often found in wet meadows, marshes, and along stream banks. Its ability to tolerate waterlogged conditions makes it an important component of wetland ecosystems.
